An Overview of Databases and Data Storage Technologies Overview 0.1 Description 0.2 Learning Goals

An Overview of Databases and Data Storage Technologies Elise Hellwig 2024-01-22 Overview 0.1 Description This workshop provides a broad overview of the various technologies for storing and organizing different collections of data. We will discuss how data structure and data types impact your storage options, when you should use a database, and which platforms you might consider for your research. This workshop is a general lecture with case studies and Q&A (no laptops necessary). This workshop is a prerequisite for DataLabâ€™s Intro to SQL for Querying Databases workshop and part of the Research Computing micro-credential 0.2 Learning Goals By the end of this workshop, learners should be able to: Describe different data set structures Compare and contrast different data storage platforms Explain the differences between SQL and noSQL databases Explain the components of an Entity Relationship Diagram (ERD) Define relational keys Identify appropriate data storage solutions based on the structure of a research data set
